abstracts.cdata!:
The overall development objective of
            Phase II of the Program (the Project) is to increase access
            to, and quality delivery of, essential health services. This
            development objective is aligned with the overall goal of
            the reform program to achieve a sustainable increase in
            access to quality preventive, curative and rehabilitative
            health services. Phase II will also support the replacement
            of the national referral hospital-QE II. This Environmental
            Assessment (EA) report evaluated impacts which include :
            solid waste management; waste water disposal; health care
            waste generation at hospitals and health centers;
            determination of disposal sites; communities response. As a
            results of these impacts the EA includes the following
            mitigation measures : training for waste handlers; training
            for participation in Medical Waste Management; develop a
            plan to stop the theft of plastic bucket type medical bins;
            maintain hospital grounds in a manner deserving of a health
            care institution; three-bin system will be implemented with
            appropriate color coding for medical staff to separate all
            hospital waste, accordingly; all infectious waste including
            sharps and used needles must be incinerated before disposal;
            organize mass media and public awareness gatherings on waste
            management issues; employ a system of Medical Wastewater
            Management that ensures that no chemicals and pathogens from
            health facilities are dump into the sewage system; and
            finally develop and implement a training and awareness
            education plan for health facilities and relevant
            institutions personnel.
